LeftText: 3	The first drops of rain fell onto the parched stones from a cloudless blue sky .
5	drunk down into the mineral silence .
10	Everyone knew , beyond belief or necessity
13	Heavy oily drops bounced from leaf to grass to dusty ground ,
14	gathering in stems and folds on the way .
15	Yet still the sky was a hard polished blue with not a cloud in sight .
16	Still the garden held its breath .
17	It would not be long now .
18	A spattering of drops plucked memories from deep in the roots ,
19	shivering through shoots and tendrils , humus and stone .
20	Wispy vapour trails marbled the blue surface above .

21	And then it rained for good .
24	no longer daring to dart out and leap around in the downfall
26	and the staccato tapping on the roof climaxed to a thunderous roar .
28	and overflowed along the edges of the lawn ,
29	cascading around the raspberry canes and over the flower beds .
30	Earthworms rose up from the water - laden earth
31	where they could no longer breath
33	and struggled fro air on the surface ,
35	and swimming for a safe haven .
36	Water burst over the barrels and cans
37	standing under the eaves and gutters ,
41	and licking at the stairs to the back porch
46	surrounded by angry water and martial beat
47	drum , drum , drumming on the roof above .
48	We slipped out feet over the sides
55	to watch them fraying and frolicking under the choppy surface .
57	washing away the boxes , and bowls , and the dog ’s basket .
58	The rocking chair , the watering can , boxes of cuttings , and tied - up newspapers , all floated away
59	as we slammed the kitchen door shut
60	and retreated to the front room
61	we gazed out at the river
65	and pressed down hard on the rooftops ,
67	When the water rippled into the hallway ,
68	we splashed our way to the staircase and then up
69	as it nipped at our heels .
70	Outside the other houses were rocks
75	to fall backwards into the crest of the oncoming waves .
78	their voices born on the winds and the salt and the rain ,
79	and we could hear them singing ,
82	And they combed their long hair in preparation .
88	their seaweed locks just out of reach .
89	With a flick of the tail they were off ,
93	until their voices were lost in the noise of the rain and the water .
99	to wrap itself twice around the world .
104	We pulled off wet socks and shoes ,
105	letting them float away on the tide ,
107	and the wake engulfed the creaking , cracking house .
108	We clambered up onto the roof ,
111	sheltering our eyes from the driving downpour .
113	and the stormy sea all the deepest , darkest blues and greens and greys
117	making way for the gnarled head of a whale ,
118	spouting water high against the clouds
120	and in a looming , booming voice called :
124	so we scrambled onto the blue - black back
125	encrusted with barnacles and cockles like stars in a night sky
132	The wind and the rain tugged at our hair .
134	We heard a fearsome creaking and cracking
135	and before our eyes a great patch of sky peeled away ,
138	with torn sails set against the wind .
139	It was a galleon with masts like a dead man ’s fingers ,
141	and a mermaid sat on the bow
147	And just as the wash hit us ,
148	prising us from the whale ’s speckled back and down into the sea ,
149	someone threw down a knotted rope
150	and we hung on for dear life .
151	The singing sailors hauled us aboard
155	And we fell onto the deck
156	like fish bursting from a net .
158	dressed in jewels and finery from a thousand pillagings .
